    "content": "import torch
from torch.utils.data import DataLoader

class Trainer:
    def __init__(self, model, optimizer, loss_fn, device, train_dataset, val_dataset, batch_size=32):
        self.model = model.to(device)
        self.optimizer = optimizer
        self.loss_fn = loss_fn
        self.device = device
        self.train_loader = DataLoader(train_dataset, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=True)
        self.val_loader = DataLoader(val_dataset, batch_size=batch_size, shuffle=False)

    def train_step(self, batch): # Removed manual device placement here
        self.model.train()
        inputs, labels = batch
        inputs = inputs.to(self.device)
        labels = labels.to(self.device)

        self.optimizer.zero_grad()
        outputs = self.model(inputs)
        loss = self.loss_fn(outputs, labels)
        loss.backward()
        self.optimizer.step()
        return loss.item()

    def val_step(self, batch): # Removed manual device placement here
        self.model.eval()
        inputs, labels = batch
        inputs = inputs.to(self.device)
        labels = labels.to(self.device)

        with torch.no_grad():
            outputs = self.model(inputs)
            loss = self.loss_fn(outputs, labels)
        return loss.item()

    def train_epoch(self):
        total_loss = 0
        for batch in self.train_loader:
            total_loss += self.train_step(batch)
        return total_loss / len(self.train_loader)

    def val_epoch(self):
        total_loss = 0
        for batch in self.val_loader:
            total_loss += self.val_step(batch)
        return total_loss / len(self.val_loader)

    def train(self, epochs):
        for epoch in range(epochs):
            train_loss = self.train_epoch()
            val_loss = self.val_epoch()
            print(f'Epoch {epoch+1}, Train Loss: {train_loss:.4f}, Val Loss: {val_loss:.4f}')
